CatDescriptText: Elaine Rosen, 5513 Forbes Street and Glenn Dorsey, 905 Roselle Court, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 28, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think race relations are improved, are worse, or about the same today as compared to pre-World War II years?" Ms. Rosen's answer reads: "Looking at the over all situation, I say that conditions have improved."  Mr. Dorsey's answer reads: "They are pretty bad.  They have improved just a little, however, not as much as they should be considering the length of time."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Elaine Rosen wearing light colored coat with unsnapped shoulder flap, dark dress, necklace, and short dark gloves, standing on sidewalk in front of store; Portrait of Glenn Dorsey wearing dark hat with rope bands, light colored shirt, and light colored zippered jacket, standing with crossed arms in front of block building
